p: Angola is the largest country in Southern Africa (1,246,700 km 2) [ 45]. It is bordered to the west by the Atlantic Ocean and the east by Zambia ( Figure 1). It shares its borders with Congo in the north and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) in the south with Namibia [ 46]. The country has more than 32 million population and is divided into eighteen provinces with a wide range of ecosystems and habitats [ 47]. Indeed, Angola lies between and within two major terrestrial biogeographic regions: the moist forests and savannas of the Congolian region; and the woodlands, savannas, and floodplains of the Zambian territories [ 48].
